intro: Peiranisia palmeri, commonly known as the Palmer's peiranisia, is a rare flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its small, daisy-like flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in rocky, arid environments, showcasing adaptations to withstand drought and high temperatures. Its leaves are narrow and hairy, which helps reduce water loss. Peiranisia palmeri is of interest to botanists due to its limited distribution and unique ecological niche.
